name: Empty Desert (Pine Ridge Tract West)
description: A vast, empty expanse of sun-baked desert, stretching towards the west under an indifferent sky. The ground is cracked and dry, dotted with sparse, hardy scrub that clings stubbornly to life. A few scattered, hardy cacti stand as silent sentinels to the relentless heat and desolation. A lone, sun-bleached wagon wheel, its spokes broken, lies half-buried in the sand, a grim reminder of a forgotten journey. To the east, south, and north, more empty scrubland stretches, promising nothing but quiet, comfortable emptiness. The air is still, thick with dust and the relentless heat, broken only by the distant caw of a crow and the endless hum of unseen insects, oblivious to the subtle grit of the west.
